Reviews.Title: “Great inexpensive place to stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: donnalorrig
Reviews.Content: I spend 9 nights at Hotel Teti this spring while tagging along with a group of college students on their spring break to Rome. It was very clean, had a private bathroom in the room, with a TV and internet access. I didn't watch the TV and the internet access was a little flakey but I really enjoyed my stay. The front desk attendants where very helpful and some of them spoke English and were all very kind about interpreting my poor Italian. There is a continental breakfast each morning which included pastries, fruit, and yogurt. I didn't eat there because of all my food allergies but I loved the little refrigerator in the room. There is a deli on the bottom floor of the same building and a couple of grocery stores nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: dournes
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in this hotel at the end of February. I paid 129 euros. It is not luxurious, but for the price it's absolutely perfect. I had a single room, which was small, but sufficient. It had a fridge, a TV, wi-fi, soap, etc. The towels were changed every day. The room was very clean. The hotel is very quiet, despite being close to Termini, which is a strong point for getting anywhere in Rome. The breakfast is quite good, compared to other 2-star hotels I've tried in the past, The staff was very discreet but efficient. I would definitely go back to this hotel and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: panospapag
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about this small hotel near termini station.Perfect for those on budget.We paid only 149 euros for 4 nights.You get what you pay for.It is really value for money.You can never get more from a 2 star hotel, especially when in Rome where it is difficult to find a decent hotel at a good price.But, Teti hotel, has those two characteristics.Everything is adequate, room size is spacious regarding Rome standards, breakfast satisfying, staff helpful, wi fi working in all areas, hot water and most important-CLEAN.Just do not hesitate to book this hotel if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Just facts! Read this!”
Reviews.Author: Tamara C
Reviews.Content: This is a 2 star hotel. That should be enough said right there... But even with 2 stars you would expect some basic necessities which this hotel did not fulfill. My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a week in January, and were VERY surprised with all the good reviews it got on Trip Advisor. We chose this hotel based on 1) TA reviews, 2) proximity to Termini station and 3) Budget. Trip Advisor let us down big time for the first time! Hotel Teti is located on the 2nd floor of an old building. This building houses a few hotels like Hotel Milo, Teti, and a few more.... Now, the good, the bad and the ugly: I'll start with the UGLY: The beds were HARD AS ROCK! Even my husband who likes firmer mattresses agrees that we would be more comfortable sleeping on the rocks of the Colosseum! I only slept well for 2 nights out of 7 because I ended up taking a sleeping pill, and was coma-toast! So if having a good bed, and in Rome you do need a good bed as you will be exhausted after a day of walking, is something that should be a necessity!!! The BAD: I guess that the rooms were clean because everything (EVERYTHING!) smelled like bleach! Sheets, curtains, towels, bleach, bleach, bleach... I don't understand what food people who write reviews on TA are used to (if any), but the breakfast could NOT be any worse... Here are your choices: corn flakes, white bread buns, butter, honey, jams, sweet croissants and danishes... I'm sure you're thinking "yum! this chick is nut!" but try eating sweets for breakfast for a week! You get a sugar crash by 11! And every day, same thing. The rooms were tiny, but that doesn't really matter, what's worse is that the bathroom is so tiny you might miss it! Shower is 2.5'x2.5', you couldn't turn around without your butt touching some wall.... The water pressure was very very poor... the door to the bathroom can't open all the way because the bed is in the way... and of course it smelled like bleach. This Hotel has an elevator but it rarely works and it starts on the 1st floor (not from the main floor). Internet connection kept failing, so we kept going to reception sometimes 5 times in one night asking them to reset their modem. The Good (or only OK): Staff was OK - there were some good ones and the ones that exhibited the behavior "I can't wait to get the hell out of here"... Location is perfect: esthetically and safety speaking: it's one of the worst areas of Rome being right beside the train/bus/central metro station; you will see homeless people everywhere, drunks, hookers (yes!!!) and transvestite hookers (YESSS!!!!) everywhere, but on every corner there is police, so it's relatively ok. But being right by Termini station (not even 5 minutes walk!) which is a central metro station in Rome, you can by metro get anywhere in Rome in about 15 mins... My husband and I are walkers so we walked a lot. You have 15 minutes walk to Colosseum, about 20 min walk to Trevi Fountain, about 30 mins to Spanish steps and the main shopping street.... Vatican by metro is about 10 minutes ride. Once we even walked back from the Vatican (about 8 km.) Keep in mind that everything in rome is relatively walk-able... and if you take Metro too much you will miss all the charms this city has to offer! All in all i would NOT NOT NOT recommend this hotel, and i can't believe the reviews it got!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gr_astro_boy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - very close to the Rome station - which is very important for tourists. The management is very friendly and always willing to help. Great breakfast! Would strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: GNU312
Reviews.Content: Great small hotel in the Termini area. We loved the breakfast and the staff was very helpful regarding a reservation screwup by hotels.com. The room was comfortable and very clean. No night noise!! Very convenient for the train station and a secure building. Loved the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for short stay and sleep over”
Reviews.Author: inuit66
Reviews.Content: Right in town center and short walk to the railway station. Very small room and bathroom, but clean. Very good service and the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: hhislim
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a budget hotel near the Termini for 1 night & our first choice was unavailable. We chose this one based, in part, on TA reviews. It is small, spartan. We arrived late & left early so we weren't expecting much. The tiny elevator begins on the first floor - so I had to haul luggage up one flight of stairs. Also had to pay extra for air conditioning. Desk attendant was pleasant. Decor was dated. It would not be my first choice in area - but if proximity & price are key needs - it is OK

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: boostar79
Reviews.Content: Hotel Teti is a small hotel on the second floor of a building that houses a few other similar, small hotels. The building looks a bit dodgy but we found Teti to be ok. Our room was small but modern. The bathroom was small but modern and clean. The location is very close to the train and bus station, only about a 5-10 minute walk. The street the hotel is located on is very busy with many other hotels and al fresco dining. The street is well lit at night with lots of people around and we felt safe walking to/from our hotel, but some of the other streets near the station seem a bit dodgy. Air con was available for an extra 10 euros per night. However, as there was a ceiling fan we opted to use this instead. Although it wasn't noisy we usually kept our window closed due to cooking smells from the restaurants below. Security was good - the main door of the building and the door of the hotel were closed at night and you had to buzz to get in. Breakfast was very basic. The beds were terrible - the mattresses were very saggy and you could feel the springs. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a budget price”
Reviews.Author: SwissCow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Teti for 5 nights during the Easter holiday in April 2011. It is a very small (as far as I saw, it has only one floor and a few rooms, since it shares the same building with a few other hotels), but it is a nice hotel within a walking distance from the main train station Termini in Rome. It is also very close to the Metro, which you can use to go around the city. I liked the service there and the hosts were very welcoming, friendly and helpful. The single room was very small, but they keep it clean. In my room there were a firm bed, a desk and chair, a bench next the bed to place a suitcase, a TV set, a refrigerator under the desk, a wardrobe with a safe inside. A bathroom was with shower, toilet and washbasin. Shower is small but absolutely fine. New towels and toiletries were provided to me every day. The inner walls are a bit thinner, so I could hear people in the neighboring room talking during the night. There is a wireless internet (included in the price) available in this hotel. I took breakfast there, which was the basic one: sweet croissants, cereals, packaged cookies, jams, fruit yoghurts, coffee and juices from a machine. However, the same food was served for breakfast every day during my stay in Hotel Teti and this could be annoying if you stay there more than a few days. For other meals, there are some good restaurants around the hotel and few supermarkets. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: frankst
Reviews.Content: This hotel was walking distance to railway station and most of the amazing tourist attractions. Great restuarants nearby , courteous staff, nice breakfasts, spacious rooms, all at a good price

Reviews.Title: “Basic ,but handy for the station.”
Reviews.Author: w00dward
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for if you're on a budget.Room was small but clean.Staff were helpful.The hotel could do with a bit of a facelift but we were'd expecting the Ritz.Don't expect great nightlife nearby.a few irish bars near by but 8 pound a pint,but you're not in Rome to party.Go to the supermarket round the corner and get a bottle of vodka and drink that before you go out.Don't get conned on Spanish steps .A bit scruffy in the local area,my partner Collette found it a bit intimating but I was fine .Very handy for some of the historical sites.

Reviews.Title: “small two stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: elicarrera
Reviews.Content: This is a small two stars hotel a few steps away from termini railway station. The location is just excellent. Even if it is a 2 stars hotel in the room you can find a fridge(empty) and a safety box.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, convenient”
Reviews.Author: expat_in_Japan
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (children 11 and 8) stayed 4 nights at the Teti. The quad room (1 double, 2 twins) was very clean (and cleaned daily), quiet, and comfortable for us. There were plenty of towels, the beds were firm and comfortable and the room was warm. The only issue was the shower - it was very clean and worked well, but was very small. My 6'2" husband's shoulders nearly touched the walls of the shower as he used it! Bigger people (i.e. bigger around) might actually not be able to use it at all. The staff were efficient (but not necessarily warm) and all of our needs were provided for. The breakfast was simple but perfectly adequate - fresh brioche rolls, sweet croissants and danish, cold cereals, packaged cookies breads, and jams. Drinks were from a machine, but we are tea drinkers so can't comment on the quality of the coffee. Free wifi was great - used my iPod touch to plan the next day's sightseeing and catch up with e-mail - and there is a laptop for guest use in the small lobby. The location of the hotel was perfect - just 2 blocks from the station so getting around was very easy, and when we left Rome by train is was a quick walk with our rolling suitcase to the station. There are many restaurants in the area - we ate somewhere different every night. We feel it was a good budget choice for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel, clean and just as expected.”
Reviews.Author: JenniferK7217
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very affordable, and clean and very safe and offered free wifi internet. We booked as we were looking for a very cheap hotel on our return to Rome for one last night before flying out, it was exactly as expected. A great place to stay on a budget. It's a bit tricky to find as it is in a plaza with many other small hotels, the sign is on the wall and does not stick out onto the road. We had no issue, just keep your eyes open. Overall, on a budget, this hotel has everything you need. The shower in this hotel was like a 3x3x7 coffin. You litterally can not extend your bent elbows fully to wash your hair, or bend over to pick up the soap if you drop it. Also, the AC was an additional charge per night, it was cool in the evenings during our stay so we did not need it. The hotel is on the 3rd floor of the block, there is a lift after the first 8 stairs. The area behind the hotel, closer to Termini should be avoided at night, it's a bit shady. However the street the hotel is on is very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: claufrs
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at this hotel and loved it. The building looks run down and you have to go up some stairs to the elevator but the hotel itself is much better than what I was expecting. The staff was very helpful, the bedroom was clean and I had fresh towels and toiletries every day. Some people say the neighborhood is dangerous but I didn't see anything that would scary me. And I found it quiet. The breakfast is great. There are some good restaurants around the hotel. As I booked 3 months in advance I got a great discount and didn't pay for air conditioning. I'll definitely stay at this hotel again if I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious , clean and quiet ...”
Reviews.Author: woanroulee
Reviews.Content: i believe the title says it all, well one thing you should be noted, the air-con is of extra charge like 20 or 25 euro per day , but instead of using the air-con, you have a big fan right above , we lived there 2 nights in the summer , we were ok with the useful fan... also, the staffs were very kind , one of the gentleman helped us to carry our luggages , and willing to tell us about the tourist spots with the map, and most importantly, i think they all dressed up decently , you won't think that you live in a low class hotel at all... also you will be given new towel everyday, and the toiletries will be provited for you...and you can use the free internet to online ...there is only one ...but you won't have scrambled eggs and bacon in the morning, just basic breakfast (coffee,juice, yogurd, croissant etc) , but don't forget it is a two stars hotel, it is on top of the ranking already.....in a nutshell, we liked it....great value!

Reviews.Title: “great, clean, well-located budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: pjt81
Reviews.Content: Hotel Teti works wonders for someone on a budget requiring an affordable single room to themselves. I stayed for four nights, plus one more before catching a plane after a 10-day excursion throughout Italy. I chose Teti in order to stay near fellow group travelers, but also because the property is two blocks from the Termini station. I could use the Metro and get pretty much anywhere I needed to go in a flash. Don't be too put off by the building Teti shares with a few other properties--the hotel itself is very clean and welcoming. The single rooms are not very big or spacious, but they serve the purpose of a clean, secure place to rest while visiting Rome. The private bathroom was always immaculate and well-stocked with towels and toiletries, but the shower is a bit cagey for a bigger, avg height-to-tall person. Room had a spacious, air-freshened armoire, and firm beds (great for anyone with back problems). Breakfast was quite standard: sweetbreads, cereal, coffee, juice. Nothing to yell about nor write home about. Just something to fill you up. Would definitely return if on a budget, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “great value, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Texans
Reviews.Content: My husband and were making our own arrangements for spending three nights in Rome prior to a cruise. We wanted someplace located near Termini Station. I found Hotel Teti on tripadvisor. Made an online reservation a couple of months in advance. Hotel was only 2 -3 blocks from the station and small (maybe 8-9 rooms). It was on an upper level of the building, but there was an elevator. Our room was small but had all necessities. Since we were there in the winter, air-conditioning wasn't necessary (it is an additional charge, if used). There was a ceiling fan that we used on slow speed for "white noise". Staff was very nice, good rate (ours was pay for two nights, get one free), and included breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Book at Teti! - ideally situated,Pleasant staff,Clean&Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireHolidaygirl
Reviews.Content: Teti hotel was perfect for us on a 3 noght break for my partners birthday prez. The airport (FCO) has a train station that has The Leonardo Express every 30mins running into the Termini station, which is literally a 5 minute walk round the corner to the hotel! Dont let the area fool you because it does look run down all around you but every building is old and Graffitti is all over too - its just one of things that they explain about if you read about Rome and its places. Hotel was great, small rooms but then your not there to spend time in your room are you? Clean linen/towels, breakfast suffice consisting of croissants, bread rolls feresh everyday, machine coffee but fine, juice, yogurts, cereals. There are plenty of restaurants, snack bars about but you have to lok for the bars (pubs) which we found 3 in our stay and were all freindly, must admit though that the pub type bars charge 10 euros for 2 drinks whereas restaurants seem cheaper. The whole tourist area (where all the sites to be seen are at) is in walking distance if you have a good pair of shoes but transport available once you get your head round the system. All in all a good trip and glad we used hotel Teti-Booked through Airbourn Direct/Travel Republic. Have a good time guys!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price near to termine that is the you can go to anywhere”
Reviews.Author: Antares100
Reviews.Content: We were looking with my wife for a clean a cheap hotel in Rome to just go to sleep after a long day walking. I found this hotel on line I went for it. This is a simple and small hotel, very clean, nice spacious room, also you can get free internet next to the lobby and a soda machine, The breakfast is more than good for the price, Also and I think the number 1 thing is that is 2 blocks for TERMINE TRAIN STATION from were you can take any kind of transportation to any were you go, Airport, other country, buses or taxis inside the city, Go for it, the hotel is a 2 star hotel,but it is good!!!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Portuguese_hurdler
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Teti, which is literally a two-minute walk from Termini station to the left as you leave the building. The hotel is on the second floor of a 5 (?) storey building that hosts various other hotels. I stayed in room 9 which opens onto the halljust three/four steps from recption. It was tiny, and the bed naturally very narrow. There was somehow still space for a desk and chair, a bench next to it to place the luggage , a wardrobe with a safe inside an of course a bathroom with shower, toilet and washbasin. Basic bathroom amenities provided: shower gel/shampoo , soap and shower cap. They were replenished after the 1st day and the towels were fine too. Both the bath room and the room itself were very clean . You could hear your neighbours arriving and even their alarm clock ringing in the morning. Luckily I was already awake so no problem. Breakfast consisted of hot beverages from a machine, juice was also from a machine . There were bread rolls ( nice and fresh) and some pastries ( also fresh ). Then you had butter, spread cheese and jam in little sealed containers, as well as little packets of cookies, pastries to choose from. The breakfast room as everything else in the hotel was small( about four tables ). There was a Japanese couple having breakfast at the same time, which was OK , but if there were two or three more people in thereat the same tine it would have been claustrophobic if and difficult to get to things. So, on the whole consisdering I paid 45 Euros a night It was perfectly satisfactory. The staff were pleasant , spoke English well ( except for the breakfast lady who doubled up as receptionist on Sunday morning - but who was very nice and helpful ). They kept my luggage for me for a few hours until I had to go to the airport. So, if you're on abudget and want to stay close to transportation links and not too far from some of the main sights ( Collosseum -10 minutes/12 mins walk away ) in a neighbourhood which, although not the most spectacular, felt perfectly safe , the Teti is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, BUT!”
Reviews.Author: rabmania
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the exterior, this is a lovely wee hotel. The BUT? I thought I'd booked a room with air conditioning. The room did have aircon, but it was 13 euros a night- or the free ceiling fan...

Reviews.Title: “Good clean accommocation in cental locatiom”
Reviews.Author: jill150
Reviews.Content: The Teti is on the 2nd floor of a 5 storey building, which is not an uncommon arrangement in Rome. Our room, No 1, was small but adequate for our needs, comprising of large bed (2 singles together), dressing table, wardrobe, chair and en-suite. Shower is small but absolutely fine. Breakfast is pastries and rolls but that's what Italians have in the mornings. There is no lounge or bar in the Teti which is a minus but the staff are ever so friendly and all speak excellent English. Beer/lager is approx 5 Euros for 0.4 litre in the bars but is far cheaper in the supermarkets. I bought 1.5 litres of red wine for 2.99 Euros and is was lovely! You'll pay 4 Euros a glass in a bar. Best bit about Teti isthe location. If you get the Terravision coach from Ciampino airport to the Termini Train Station it's only 2 roads back. You can pull your luggage 2 streets. If you like walking, like we do, all the sights are within walking distance, which is amazing. If you take a Colusseum Tour go with Romaround Tours. they may seem pricey but well worth it to hear all the history from the excellent guides. We had Roberto at the Colusseum and Jennifer at the Palantine Palace and also for the Vatical Tours. they were absolutely spot on and very interesting. We also went on the City Sightseeing Tours which are the hop on/hop off red double eckers that are present in most large cities. Again the tours al speak expellent English. Watch out for pickpockets. My husband cought a girl with her hand inside my bag. they are so quick - and we are used to travelling and are always most careful.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, ideal for local transport.”
Reviews.Author: Twoflower71
Reviews.Content: The room was of adequate size and I was especially pleased to find a small fridge built into the dressing table! This was perfect for keeping milk (and wine) chilled - and it was SILENT so didn't disturb our sleep. There was also a double wardrobe recessed in the room, as well as coat hooks near the door. Inside the wardrobe was a safe-box - no extra charge. (No hair-dryer.) The breakfast was okay - but I didn't enjoy the drinks from the self-service machine. We were two mature ladies visiting Rome for the first time and found the location of this hotel ideal for us, near to the Termini station. On arrival didn't like having to carry suitcases up 13 marble steps in order to reach the lift. Generally a great experience and would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value short stay”
Reviews.Author: arnoldbennett
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the unprepossessing entrance to the Teti - once you locate it (on the second floor of a multi-use block) you will find a welcoming staff and good basic facilities. You won't be expecting anything luxurious, but the room was clean, the bed comfortable, the water hot, the breakfast adequate and the location (two streets from Termini) great for a short stay. Not much natural light in the room but all you will want it for is to sleep in, so who cares? Plenty of reasonable places to eat in the vicinity and the main Roman sites in easy walking distance. Good value in my opinion - try it!

Reviews.Title: “Teti is small but clean!!”
Reviews.Author: ScottnAude
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel for a short stay in Rome or if you are passing through. Don't be put off by the entrance from the road the Teti is clean and adequate for a 2-3 night stay in Rome and is 2 minute walk from the train station (termini). Breakfast is sufficient. The Hotel is on the 2nd floor but when we stayed here the lift was under renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel at a very good price”
Reviews.Author: PinkTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Teti is in a perfect location for touring Rome near Termini and Santa Maria Maggiore, we have stopped in the area a number of times and this hotel whilst being small was more than adequate and of a very good standard at an excellent price. The staff were helpful, the rooms well decorated and cleaned thouroughly - I couldn't fault the holiday. Some of the restauraunts locally to look out for are the Tudini on Via Cavour and the Giglio Dell Opera at the side of the opera House - fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Cramped and noisy but convenient”
Reviews.Author: IrishKitty
Reviews.Content: The room was very small, the bed was far too narrow for comfort (the same width as the pillow) and rather firm. The bathroom was very cramped and there was hardly any room to move in the shower stall, which had mildew on the door. It was quite noisy. Although the double-glazed windows effectively shut out most street noises, I could clearly hear people talking in the reception area, and the buzzer when guests returned late at night. I could also hear people in neighbouring rooms, despite wearing earplugs. On the plus side, the staff are courteous and friendly, the room is equipped with a safe, the decor is attractive, if a bit shabby, and the location is extremely convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jayrhys
Reviews.Content: Hotel Teti was a great budget hotel. I was a single female traveller and felt very safe at this hotel. It is clean and the staff are friendly. The decor is nice considering the curtains match the bedspread which showed effort. However, it is noisy. The trolley runs alongside the hotel and there are restaurants on both sides with chairs outside. The breakfast is only a croissant and sponge cake. Some fruit would be welcome. The coffee and juice machines are awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmberChatwin
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing stay at this hotel, the room was well priced, large, small bathroom but with power shower (what a treat), fantastic staff, brilliant proximity to colloseum, trevi fountain and all metro points!the area isnt the best but loved it all the same!would definitely go back, i thouroughly recommend Hotel Teti!

Reviews.Title: “Small, budget, hotel, near Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're just looking for a comfortable place to sleep then I would certainly recommend this hotel. Small 2 star superior hotel. 2 minutes walk from Termini Station. Rooms were very clean. Staff were very friendly. The area around Termini is a bit seedy but neither myself or my 10 year old daughter felt threatened. Great location. If breakfast isn't included in the price of your trip don't pay the extra for it. There are plenty of places to get a decent breakfast close by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “small room but good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: room is extreamly small. breakfast is terriable. but the location is very good. 2 mins walking to Termini is very convience for traveller. bathroom is very small and the pressure of water is not enough. elevator is difficult to use and not comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Teti”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bathroom was extremely tiny. If you dropped the soap in the shower you would have to get out to pick it up as the shower was so small and at the back of the bi-folding shower screen there was mildew. For the rest of the room, it was kept clean. For what we paid I think we were overcharged. Would not recommend this place to anyone. Maybe backpackers

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Teti
HotelInfo.Address: Via Principe Amedeo, 76, 00185 Rome, Italy
